Description: A dietary supplement company was sentenced to pay a $1 million fine and a $200,000 community service fee for illegally discharging pollutants into the Vermilion River.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Description: Omega was charged with violations of the CWA and Oil Pollution Act {33 U.S.C. 1319(c)(2)(A) - knowingly discharging a pollution, in violation of 33 U.S.C. 1311; and 33 U.S.C. 1321(b)(3) - knowingly discharging oil}. Omega pled guilty to the charges and was sentenced to 36 months probation and ordered to pay $5.5 million in federal fines and $2 million in court ordered fines, totaling $7.5M.
